thread.section_title: The Columbus Dispatch High School Sports Feed
thread.title: High-school football | OCC roundup: Upper Arlington pulls away from Central Crossing
thread.title_full: High-school football | OCC roundup: Upper Arlington pulls away from Central Crossing

title: High-school football | OCC roundup: Upper Arlington pulls away from Central Crossing
text:
Hilliard Davidson 38, Westland 3 The Columbus Dispatch • Saturday October 3, 2015 12:53 AM 
Upper Arlington 46, Central Crossing 39: Danny Logan scored a pair of third-quarter touchdowns and ran for 203 yards to help Upper Arlington (5-1, 2-1) defeat visiting Central Crossing (3-3, 1-2) in an Ohio Capital Conference Central Division game on Friday night. With UA trailing 28-25, Logan caught a 48-yard TD pass from Vince Murdocco and followed four minutes later with a 52-yard TD run to give the Golden Bears a 39-28 lead. Central Crossing quarterback Deric Williamson, who completed 28 of 45 passes for 325 yards, threw a 28-yard touchdown pass to Noah Stephens late in the third quarter, but Murdocco threw his third TD pass of the night to Michael Smith. Logan added 70 yards receiving, and Cole Kaparos had 129 yards rushing and two TDs for UA. Stephens finished with 10 receptions and 139 yards and two touchdowns. The teams combined for 1,018 yards, 546 for UA. Worthington Kilbourne 23, Big Walnut 16: Josh Stoner had a 60-yard punt return for a TD and Nick Hill a 31-yard interception return for a score to lead Worthington Kilbourne (6-0, 3-0) over host Big Walnut (2-4, 1-2) in the OCC Capital. Isaiah Young had 163 yards rushing on 23 carries and a 56-yard TD run for the Wolves. New Albany 38, Delaware 14: Casey Horch completed 7 of 14 passes for 173 yards and two TDs, and New Albany (4-2, 3-0) pulled away from visiting Delaware (2-4, 0-3) in the OCC Capital. Horch threw a 72-yard TD pass to Victor White and a 15-yard score to Trent Twinam. Ethan Tucky rushed for 138 yards and a TD for Delaware. Olentangy 45, Franklin Heights 14: Deeb Haber completed 16 of 20 passes for 232 yards and four TDs, and Olentangy (5-1, 3-0) scored 45 unanswered points after spotting an early lead to Franklin Heights (3-3, 1-2) in the OCC Capital. Jacob O’Donnell caught TD passes of 15, 11 and 23 yards for the Braves. Cam Kennedy added 133 yards rushing for Olentangy. Dylan Akers threw for 222 yards and two TDs for Franklin Heights. Olentangy Orange 35, Mount Vernon 0: JD Dayhuff completed 8 of 11 passes for 161 yards and three TDs, and Olentangy Orange (1-5, 1-2) quickly jumped on visiting Mount Vernon (3-3, 0-3) in the OCC Capital. Tyler Lichter rushed for 150 yards and two TDs for Orange, which led 28-0 at halftime. Hunter Shepherd caught two passes, both for TDs. Hilliard Darby 38, Canal Winchester 0: Nick Powers rushed for 173 yards and five TDs, and Hilliard Darby (6-0, 3-0) shut down host Canal Winchester (0-6, 0-3) in the OCC Cardinal. Powers had TD runs of 3, 3, 3, 64 and 1 yards. Darby totaled 384 yards of offense and held Canal Winchester to 77. Dublin Coffman 49, Thomas Worthington 0: Casey Kirk had 169 yards rushing and three touchdowns, and Dublin Coffman (4-2, 2-1) blanked host Thomas Worthington (1-5, 0-3) in the OCC Central. Gunnar Hoak threw a pair of TD passes for the Shamrocks, who returned two interceptions for touchdowns and scored all of their points in the first half. Hilliard Davidson 38, Westland 3: Ryan Royer scored two first-quarter TDs, and Hilliard Davidson (5-1, 3-0) returned two interceptions for TDs to defeat host Westland (4-2, 2-1) and take sole possession of first place in the OCC Central. Olentangy Liberty 7, Marysville 0: Alex Lando tossed a 9-yard touchdown pass to Drew Rosi in the first quarter, and Olentangy Liberty (5-1, 2-1) stopped host Marysville (1-5, 0-3) in the OCC Central. Lando threw for 136 yards and added 96 yards rushing for the Patriots, whose defense forced eight Marysville punts. The Monarchs blocked two Liberty field-goal attempts, but only managed 117 yards on offense. Gahanna 31, Reynoldsburg 8: Gahanna (5-1, 3-0) scored 24 points in the fourth quarter, capped by an interception return for a TD by Jeremiah Campbell, to come back and defeat visiting Reynoldsburg (3-3, 1-2) in the OCC Ohio. Kent Johnson led Gahanna with 86 yards rushing. Mason Blancett accounted for three touchdowns, two rushing and a 10-yard pass to Elijah Whiteside. The Lions defense forced four turnovers, including three interceptions. Grove City 28, Newark 21: Dylan Schoonover’s 14-yard TD run with 1:21 remaining lifted Grove City (2-4, 1-2) to an OCC Ohio win over host Newark (0-6, 0-3). Jeremy Ford had a game-high 173 yards rushing and two touchdowns for the Greyhounds. D’ante Woods led Newark with 112 yards rushing and two TDs. Lancaster 21, Groveport 9: Shea Goss and Tyler Carter scored first-quarter TDs, and Lancaster (6-0, 3-0) shut down host Groveport (4-2, 1-2) in the OCC Ohio. Ryan Fitchpatrick rushed for a career high 179 yards and a TD for the Gales.
